au_23688: ls -cr | head -n 100

find . -mindepth 1 -maxdepth 1 -exec stat -c $'%Z\t%n' '{}' \; |
    sort -k 1n |
    cut -f 2 -d $'\t' |
    head -n 10 |
    sed -e 's/^\.\///'

find . -mindepth 1 -maxdepth 1 -exec stat -c $'%W\t%n' '{}' \; |
    sort -k 1n |
    cut -f 2 -d $'\t' |
    head -n 10 |
    sed -e 's/^\.\///'

Explanations about Options.-n:
print the first NUM lines instead of the first 10; with the leading '-', print all
 but the last NUM lines of each file

au_443571: get_crtime() {

    for target in "${@}"; do
        inode=$(ls -di "${target}" | cut -d ' ' -f 1)
        fs=$(df  --output=source "${target}"  | tail -1)
        crtime=$(sudo debugfs -R 'stat <'"${inode}"'>' "${fs}" 2>/dev/null | 
        grep -oP 'crtime.*--\s*\K.*')
        printf "%s\t%s\n" "${target}" "${crtime}"
    done
}

Explanations about Options.-n:
output the last NUM lines, instead of the last 10; or use -n +NUM to output
 starting with line NUM
